intro: Phacelia tetramera, commonly known as blue flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Phacelia tetramera is also valued for its role in supporting pollinators and its use in ecological restoration projects.
